p: Two conversions of Braun‐Blanquet's scale were used for subsequent analyses. The Braun‐Blanquet's scale was converted into the median of the cover class (Table 2), in order to test the changes in the species cover between the different periods. By contrast, for all other analyses (Simpson diversity, Bray–Curtis dissimilarity, PCA, mean ecological values), numerical codes (Gillet 2000) were used because they preserve the importance of the less abundant species, a crucial point in such analyses, by reducing the weight given to dominant ones (high cover).
